p: Newly synthesized compounds 2â€“ 5 were evaluated for their activity against HIV-1 in a CEM-T4 cell line. First, a cytotoxicity assessment of the synthesized derivatives was performed using the MTT [3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide]. The results were expressed as CC 50 (concentration of compound causing 50% cell death). Anti-HIV activity was expressed as IC 50 (concentration of compound causing 50% inhibition of replication) and consisted of measurements of p24 antigen made using the Genscreen ULTRA HIV Ag-Ab Kit. Betulin 1 and BVM were used as reference compounds. The bioassay results are presented in Table 1.
